attributes.action: Stop Networks locking mobile phones to their networks
attributes.additional_details: At present mobile phone network operators such as Orange can lock new mobile phones so they cannot be used on other rival networks with a new SIM card. They will "unlock" the phones for a £20 fee. This is iniquitous and anti-competitive and should not be allowed. I ask the government to stop mobile phone network operators from selling or distributing mobile phones locked to their network.
